thread.title: Murray crushes APSU’s hopes of repeating victory
thread.title_full: Murray crushes APSU’s hopes of repeating victory

title: Murray crushes APSU’s hopes of repeating victory
text:
Murray crushes APSU’s hopes of repeating victory Autumn Allison, aallison@theleafchronicle.com 9:41 p.m. CDT October 10, 2015 Governors leave the field at halftime of the 34-18 loss to Murray State on Saturday. (Photo: Autumn Allison/The Leaf-Chronicle) 6 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MURRAY, Ky. — Austin Peay needed lightning to strike twice to secure a win against Murray State for the second year in a row. 
Too bad it was a cloudless sky. 
The Governors fell 34-18 in the Racers’ homecoming game on Saturday after MSU’s dominating second quarter. 
Austin Peay dropped to 0-6 and 0-3 in the OVC. 
“Ultimately you have to be able to keep in mind that the game is not out of hand, it’s not 60 to nothing. It’s not that at all …,” said Govs sophomore running back Kendall Morris. “You have to be willing to go out there and fight. … I think we haven’t been in that situation at all this season were you come back in and fight back-and-forth.” 
Last season, Austin Peay pulled off a 20-13 victory to break the nation’s longest losing streak when the Govs hosted Murray. That was the last game the Governors have won. 
“The guys aren’t happy,” said third-year APSU coach Kirby Cannon. “Nobody is happy.” 
Morris pulled off his second straight game with 100-plus rushing yards, finishing with 136 and touchdown. 
“We said Morris was going to be a big guy that could take little ones and turn them into big ones, and the option play he scored on today was pure speed. I don’t know if anyone in the league can catch him,” Cannon said. 
Quarterback KD Humphries ran in from the 1-yard line for Murray State’s first touchdown, and Roman Clay’s short run six minutes later boosted the Racers to a 14-0 lead. 
Humphries had 286 passing yards, completing 32 of 51 attempts. 
“Their quarterback is a lot better this year,” Cannon said. “ … He threw some darts.” 
With just 20 seconds left in the first quarter, the Governors marched down the field and added six points from freshman running back Taye Davis. 
Clay had another touchdown run. A Connor Mitchell 23-yard field goal and another Humphries touchdown gave Murray State a 31-6 lead at halftime. 
In the second half, the Govs Timarious Mitchell came in at quarterback for Trey Taylor and connected with Jared Beard on a 10-yard pass. 
“He (Timarious) has been one of my favorite quarterbacks since I got here,” Beard said. “I like the touch he puts on the ball. I like the way he throws. His balls are really easy to catch. … I’ve always had confidence in Timarious being on the field.” 
Austin Peay made another march to the end zone, on Morris’ 62-yard dash. 
The Governors return home to host UT Martin at 4 p.m. on Saturday. 
Reach Autumn Allison at aallison@theleafchronicle.com or (931) 245-0258. Follow her on Twitter: @Aallison25 . 6 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://leafne.ws/1LowQDh TOP VIDEOS
